Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Since there's no explicit case ID, I have to infer them based on the attributes provided. Let me go through each event step by step and try to group them logically.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting with Event 1: Registration in ER for a 45-year-old male. Next, Event 4 is triage for the same age and gender in ER. Then Event 7 is an X-ray, Event 12 is a doctor consultation, and Event 15 is discharge. All these are in ER and match the 45 M. So these events (1,4,7,12,15) form one case.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 2 is registration for 62 F in ER. Event 5 is triage, Event 8 is lab request, Event 10 is lab completion, Event 11 is consultation, Event 14 is prescription, and Event 17 is discharge. These all match 62 F in ER, so they form another case (2,5,8,10,11,14,17).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 3 is registration in Surgery for 28 M. Event 6 is consultation, Event 9 is prep, Event 13 is surgery, Event 16 is recovery, and Event 18 is discharge. All in Surgery with 28 M, so they form the third case (3,6,9,13,16,18).

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Each case is grouped based on consistent age, gender, and department, with activities following a logical sequence from registration through discharge.
